Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is grey-black in section, the interior is ribbed and covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394795) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394795)
